thread.title: Astros earn playoff berth thanks to Rangers
thread.title_full: Astros earn playoff berth thanks to Rangers

author: Bob Nightengale, USA TODAY Sports
title: Astros earn playoff berth thanks to Rangers
text:
Astros earn playoff berth thanks to Rangers USA Today Sports 2 hrs ago by Bob Nightengale, USA TODAY Sports © LM Otero, AP LM Otero, AP PHOENIX -- Forget all of the hype about this Texas Rangers and Houston Astros rivalry.
AdChoices The Astros just became the Rangers’ best friend Sunday afternoon, and certainly their biggest fans.
The Rangers knocked off the Los Angles Angeles, 9-2, clinching the American League West, which automatically clinches the final wild-card berth for the Astros.
The Astros lost 5-3 to the Arizona Diamondbacks and lost home-field advantage against the the New York Yankees on Tuesday night in the wild card game.
The Yankees lost again to the Baltimore Orioles, meaning that if the Astros win, they’ll host their first playoff game since 2005.
Certainly, with Cy Young favorite Dallas Keuchel scheduled to pitch the wild-card game, would much prefer being at home where Keuchel has been nothing short of spectacular.
Keuchel, who would be pitching on three days’ rest, is 15-0 with a 1.46 ERA in 18 starts at Minute Maid Park, compared to 5-8 with a 3.77 ERA on the road.
Yes, the Astros would love their chances.
Then again, the Astros, who are 53-28 at home this year, suddenly are starting to play much better on the road, too, going 4-1 in the first five games of this trip.
“We’re digging these gray uniforms,’’ Astros manager A.J. Hinch said before the game.
Really, the Astros say it won’t faze them wherever they play the Yankees.
We have no fear of young players being put in this position,’’ Hinch said, “or having these big moments. They’ve handled themselves to a man with a ton of confidence, and a ton of ease.
“You’ll see an excited team, not a scared or nervous team.’’
